meanings.definition: A type of root vegetable with a long, pale yellowish-white edible root.
meanings.sent1: I planted some parsnips in my garden last spring.
meanings.sent2: The parsnip soup was delicious and comforting on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent3: Why did the parsnip go to school? To get a little 'root' education!
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as pale as a parsnip in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The parsnip's long, white root stood out among the other vegetables in the basket.

meanings.definition: To cut into thin strips or slices, resembling the shape of a parsnip.
meanings.sent1: She carefully parsnipped the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to parsnip the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent3: Why did the vegetable break up with the knife? It couldn't handle being parsnipped anymore!
meanings.sent4: The sunlight parsnipped through the leaves, creating beautiful patterns on the ground.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he parsnipped the paper into intricate snowflake shapes.
